item.name: DbEntryComparison
item.para: The returned by this method in derived classes actually boxes a more specific, derived . For example, 's method returns a boxed as a , while 's method returns a boxed as a .

In addition, most derived database classes also expose a method for fetching strongly typed database entries. For example, has a method for fetching entries, while has a method for fetching entries. Thus, the following two method calls return an identical object; the latter is simply more specific (and more readable) than the former.

code.title: Comparison of Database Entry Query Methods

item.para: The strongly typed methods should always be preferred for fetching database entries; its use is both more readable and less error prone. This method should only be used in rare situations where you need to look up a specific database entry by ID number, but do not have access to the strongly typed database instance.

item.name: CompoundVsComposite
item.note: Do not confuse a KEGG "composite" database with the CompoundDbLink database. A composite database is a database that is "composed of" several "simple" KEGG databases. For example, the LigandDbLink composite database includes data from the ReactionDbLink, ReactionClassDbLink, and GlycanDbLink databases, among others. The CompoundDbLink database, on the other hand, is a particular simple database, which contains data on chemical compounds.

item.name: GenomeDbEntryComments
item.summary: Returns the GenomeDbLink database entry with the given GenomeDbPrefix number.
item.param: The GenomeDbPrefix number of the GenomeDbLink database entry.
item.returns: A lightweight object representing the GenomeDbLink database entry with the given GenomeDbPrefix number.

item.name: EnzymeDbEntryComments
item.summary: Returns the EnzymeDbLink database entry with the given EC number.
item.param: The first part of the EnzymeDbLink database entry's EC number, which identifies the enzyme's general catalytic role.
The second part of the EnzymeDbLink database entry's EC number.
The third part of the EnzymeDbLink database entry's EC number.
The fourth part of the EnzymeDbLink database entry's EC number, which uniquely identifies the enzyme.
item.returns: A lightweight object representing the EnzymeDbLink database entry with the given EC number.
